title: Advanced boolean behavior: and/or return operands, evaluation order, and subtle conditional bugs
content:
At hard difficulty, conditionals become tricky because `and`/`or` do more than produce True/False: they can **return one of their operands**, and they **short-circuit** evaluation.

---
## 1) and/or return values

```python
print(0 and 99)        # 0
print(5 and 99)        # 99

print("hi" or "bye")  # hi
print("" or "bye")    # bye
```

This is why “defaulting” works:

```python
name = ""
display = name or "(anonymous)"
print(display)
```

But be careful: `0` is falsy, so it will also fall back.

```python
n = 0
print(n or 123)  # 123 (maybe not desired)
```

If 0 is valid, be explicit:

```python
n = 0
fallback = 123
print(fallback if n is None else n)
```

---
## 2) Short-circuit prevents errors (guard patterns)

```python
obj = None

# safe: second part runs only if first part is True
if obj is not None and obj.get("k") == 1:
    print("match")
else:
    print("no")
```

---
## 3) Precedence and parentheses
When conditions get long, parentheses improve clarity.

```python
age = 19
has_ticket = True
vip = False

if (age >= 18 and has_ticket) or vip:
    print("enter")
else:
    print("no")
```

---
## 4) any/all: make complex checks readable

```python
password = "Abc123"

rules = [
    len(password) >= 6,
    any(ch.isdigit() for ch in password),
    any(ch.isupper() for ch in password),
]

if all(rules):
    print("ok")
else:
    print("try again")
```

---
## 5) A larger example: choose a safe default without losing information

```python
def display_name(user):
    # user may be None, or a dict with optional fields
    if user is None:
        return "(missing user)"

    # prefer nickname, then name, then id
    nick = user.get("nickname")
    name = user.get("name")
    uid = user.get("id")

    # careful: nick/name could be empty strings and that might matter
    if nick is not None and nick != "":
        return nick
    if name is not None and name != "":
        return name
    return f"user-{uid}" if uid is not None else "(unknown)"

print(display_name({"nickname": "", "name": "Ana", "id": 7}))
print(display_name({"name": "", "id": 7}))
print(display_name(None))
```
